issues.title: Missing Requirement for Safety Plan Copies to Law Enforcement
issues.description: California law requires that copies of the comprehensive school safety plan be provided to law enforcement agencies that are the designated first responders to the school. This requirement is completely absent from both the policy and regulation.

legal_citations.text: The comprehensive school safety plan shall be provided to the law enforcement agency or agencies that are the designated first responders to the school for emergency situations.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall provide copies of each school's comprehensive safety plan to the law enforcement agency or agencies that are the designated first responders to that school for emergency situations.

issues.title: Missing School Safety Plan Review Timeline
issues.description: While the policy states plans must be reviewed and updated by March 1, it fails to specify that this review must occur at least once per year, and the regulation lacks procedural details for ensuring this timeline is met.

legal_citations.text: The school site council shall review and update the school safety plan at least once per year by March 1.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall establish procedures to ensure that each school site council reviews and updates its comprehensive school safety plan at least once per year by March 1. The procedures shall include monitoring compliance and providing support to schools to meet this deadline.

issues.title: Incomplete Disaster Procedures Requirements
issues.description: The regulation mentions earthquake emergency procedures but fails to include the specific requirement for fire and other emergency procedures as mandated by law.

legal_citations.text: Routine and emergency disaster procedures, including adaptations for students with disabilities in accordance with the federal Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, procedures for fire, flood, earthquake, terrorist threats, and other emergencies that threaten the safety of students or staff.

issues.required_language: Routine and emergency disaster procedures including, but not limited to: fire, flood, earthquake, terrorist threats, and other emergencies that threaten the safety of students or staff, with adaptations for students with disabilities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act.

issues.title: Missing Reference to Penal Code 11174.3 for Child Abuse Reporting
issues.description: The regulation references Penal Code 11164 for child abuse reporting procedures but should also reference the more comprehensive Penal Code 11174.3 which contains additional requirements for school personnel.

legal_citations.text: Child abuse reporting procedures consistent with Article 2.5 (commencing with Section 11164) of Chapter 2 of Title 1 of Part 4 of the Penal Code.

issues.required_language: Child abuse reporting procedures consistent with Penal Code 11164 et seq., including the requirements of Penal Code 11174.3 regarding training and reporting obligations for school personnel.

issues.title: Missing Specific Reference to Suspension/Expulsion Policies
issues.description: The regulation references Education Code 48915(c) but should more clearly connect to the district's specific suspension and expulsion policies to ensure consistency.

legal_citations.text: Policies pursuant to subdivision (c) of Section 48915 and other school-designated serious acts which would lead to suspension, expulsion, or mandatory expulsion recommendations.

issues.required_language: Policies pursuant to Education Code 48915(c) and other school-designated serious acts which would lead to suspension, expulsion, or mandatory expulsion recommendations, consistent with the district's suspension and expulsion policies and procedures.
